snippet: Voting began on Thursday to reauthorize the executive director of the N.H.L. players’ association to effectively dissolve the union, opening the way for players to file antitrust suits against the league.
abstract: Hopes for a prompt settlement in 110-day old NHL lockout are scuttled when players begin voting to reauthorize Donald Fehr, union’s executive director, to disclaim interest in representing the union; if Fehr disclaims, it would effectively dissolve union and open the way for players to file antitrust lawsuits against league.
lead_paragraph: Voting began on Thursday to reauthorize the executive director of the N.H.L. players’ association to effectively dissolve the union, opening the way for players to file antitrust suits against the league.

headline.seo: After Spurt of Optimism, N.H.L. Union Considers Options
headline.main: After a Spurt of Optimism in N.H.L. Lockout, Union Considers Options
headline.print_headline: After a Spurt of Optimism, Union Considers Options
